meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>damp</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to be damp</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to be moist</vocabulary>. Ewww.
readingMnemonic: You know what's really damp and moist? <reading>Shee</reading>p <reading>me</reading>n (しめ) are. They've been hanging out in a greenhouse and now their wool is all damp. They're going to need a towel to dry off.
